entries.notes: Op. 9 no. 1 of 1770 ('opera grande') in Boccherini's autograph catalogue.

ms_copies_parts: Naples, Conservatorio. Two copies: 22.2.10, 'Quartetto no. 6...' and 22.5.6, 'Quartetto no. 4... per uso di S. E. Abbate Don Antonio Giorgio'
sources.first_edition: December, 1769, Paris, Vénier: Op. 6 no. 6 (for title, see No. 165).
later_editions: (c. 1770), London, Longman Lukey: Op. 4 no. 6 (for title, see No. 166).
(c. 1775), London, Bremner: Op. 6 no. 6 (for title, see No. 166).
(c. 1780), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 2 no. 6 (for title, see No. 166).
(c. 1785), Paris, Boyer-Naderman: Op. 6 no. 6 (for title, see No. 165).
sources.modern_edition: (c. 1930), Leipzig, Peters: Op. 6 no. 6 (revised by R. Hofmann; separate parts). This edition was re-published c. 1943 by the International Music Co., New York. 1953, Milan, Ricordi: Op. 6 no. 6 (pocket score; revised by Enrico Polo).
arrangements: Of the second movement, as part of a quartet (no. 1) for flute, clarinet, horn and bassoon, by O. Van den Brock, c. 1820 (see No. 263).

partial_notes: Page starts with continuation of G.170 entry showing movement 3 and complete source information. G.171 entry begins but appears to continue on next page.
